verses.devanagari:
अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवमृत्विजम् ।
होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥
verses.iast: agnim īḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam | hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam ||
verses.translation: I praise Agni, the priest set in front, the divine ministrant of the sacrifice, the hotar, best bestower of riches.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निः पूर्वेभिरृषिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत ।
स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥
verses.iast: agniḥ pūrvebhir ṛṣibhir īḍyo nūtanair uta | sa devāṃ eha vakṣati ||
verses.translation: Praised by the seers of old and by those of today, Agni brings the gods here.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निना रयिमश्नवद् पोषमेव दिवेदिवे ।
यशसं वीरवत्तमम् ॥
verses.iast: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva dive-dive | yaśasaṃ vīravattamam ||
verses.translation: Through Agni one attains wealth—ever-growing nourishment and the most glorious, heroic renown, day by day.

verses.devanagari:
अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि ।
स इद्देवेषु गच्छति ॥
verses.iast: agne yaṃ yajñam adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi | sa id deveṣu gacchati ||
verses.translation: O Agni, the sacrifice which you safeguard on every side—truly that reaches the gods.

verses.devanagari:
अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुḥ सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः ।
देवो देवेभिरा गमत् ॥
verses.iast: agnir hotā kavikratuḥ satyaś citraśravastamaḥ | devo devebhir ā gamat ||
verses.translation: May Agni, the hotar, wise in will, truthful and most renowned, come here with the gods.

verses.devanagari:
यदङ्ग दाशुषे त्वमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि ।
तवेत्तत्सत्यमङ्गिरः ॥
verses.iast: yad aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadraṃ kariṣyasi | tavet tat satyam aṅgiraḥ ||
verses.translation: Whatever good you shall do for the giver, O Agni—of you, O Aṅgiras, that indeed is true.

verses.devanagari:
उप त्वाग्ने दिवेदिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम् ।
नमो भरन्त एमसि ॥
verses.iast: upa tvāgne dive-dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam | namo bharanta emasi ||
verses.translation: Day by day we draw near to you, Agni, with our thought, bringing homage.

verses.devanagari:
राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपामृतस्य दीदिविम् ।
वर्धमानं स्वे दमे ॥
verses.iast: rājantam adhvarāṇāṃ gopām ṛtasya dīdivim | vardhamānaṃ sve dame ||
verses.translation: Radiant lord of the rites, guardian of ṛta, ever-gleaming, growing in his own abode.

verses.devanagari:
स नः पितेव सूनवेऽग्ने सूपायनो भव ।
सचस्वा नः स्वस्तये ॥
verses.iast: sa naḥ piteva sūnave 'gne sūpāyano bhava | sacasvā naḥ svastaye ||
verses.translation: Be to us, Agni, easy of approach like a father to his son; abide with us for our welfare.

verses.devanagari:
वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंकृताः ।
तेषां पाहि श्रुधी हवम् ॥
verses.iast: vāyav ā yāhi darśateme somā araṅkṛtāḥ | teṣām pāhi śrudhī havam ||
verses.translation: Vāyu, come—these Soma draughts prepared to delight are here; drink of them and hearken to our call.

verses.devanagari:
वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंकृताः ।
तेषां पाहि श्रुधी हवम् ॥
verses.iast:
vāyav ā yāhi darśateme somā araṅkṛtāḥ |
teṣām pāhi śrudhī havam ||
verses.translation: Vāyu, come! These Soma draughts are readied—drink of them and listen to our call.

verses.devanagari:
वायु उक्थेभिर्जरन्ते त्वामच्छा जरितारः ।
सुतसोमा अहर्विदः ॥
verses.iast:
vāyu ukthebhir jarante tvām acchā jaritāraḥ |
sutasomā aharvidaḥ ||
verses.translation: The singers, versed in the rite, laud you with hymns, O Vāyu, their Soma pressed.

verses.devanagari:
वायो तव प्रपृञ्चती धेना जिगाति दाशुषे ।
उरूची सोमपीतये ॥
verses.iast:
vāyo tava prapṛñcatī dhenā jigāti dāśuṣe |
urūcī somapītaye ||
verses.translation: Your approving voice, O Vāyu, comes to the giver—broadly inviting you to drink the Soma.

verses.devanagari:
इन्द्रवायू इमे सुता उप प्रयोभिरा गतम् ।
इन्दवो वामुशन्ति हि ॥
verses.iast:
indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhir ā gatam |
indavo vām uśanti hi ||
verses.translation: Indra and Vāyu, these pressings await you—come with delights; the Soma-drops long for you both.

verses.devanagari:
वायविन्द्रश्च चेतथः सुतानां वाजिनीवसू ।
तावा यातमुप द्रवत् ॥
verses.iast:
vāyav indraś ca cetathaḥ sutānāṃ vājinīvasū |
tāv ā yātam upa dravat ||
verses.translation: Vāyu and Indra, you mark the Soma pressings—come swiftly, hasten to us.

verses.devanagari:
वायविन्द्रश्च सुन्वत आ यातमुप निष्कृतम् ।
मक्ष्वित्था धिया नराः ॥
verses.iast:
vāyav indraś ca sunvata ā yātam upa niṣkṛtam |
makṣv itthā dhiyā narāḥ ||
verses.translation: Vāyu and Indra, come quickly to the sacrificer’s prepared rite, O heroes, with wise intent.

verses.devanagari:
मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च रिशादसम् ।
धियं घृताचीं साधन्ता ॥
verses.iast:
mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam |
dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīṃ sādhantā ||
verses.translation: I call Mitra of purified power and Varuṇa the smiter of foes, who perfect the clarified understanding.

verses.devanagari:
ऋतेन मित्रावरुणावृतावृधावृतस्पृशा ।
क्रतुं बृहन्तमाशाथे ॥
verses.iast:
ṛtena mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvṛdhāv ṛtaspṛśā |
kratuṃ bṛhantam āśāthe ||
verses.translation: Through ṛta, Mitra and Varuṇa—augmenters and touchers of ṛta—attain and bestow a mighty will.

verses.devanagari:
कवी नो मित्रावरुणा तुविजाता उरुक्षया ।
दक्षं दधाते अपसम् ॥
verses.iast:
kavī no mitrāvaruṇā tuvijātā urukṣayā |
dakṣaṃ dadhāte apasam ||
verses.translation: Mitra and Varuṇa, wise and mighty-born, dwelling wide—establish for us effective strength.

verses.devanagari:
अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो द्रवत्पाणी शुभस्पती ।
पुरुभुजा चनस्यतम् ॥
verses.iast: aśvinā yajvarīr iṣo dravatpāṇī śubhaspatī | purubhujā canasyatam ||
verses.translation: O Aśvins, swift-handed lords of welfare, be pleased with the sacrificial offerings.

verses.devanagari:
अश्विना पुरुदंससा नरा शवीरया धिया ।
धिष्ण्या वनतं गिरः ॥
verses.iast: aśvinā purudaṃsasā narā śavīrayā dhiyā | dhiṣṇyā vanataṃ giraḥ ||
verses.translation: Aśvins, wonder-working heroes, with puissant thought, O throne-lords, attend our hymns.

verses.devanagari:
दस्रा युवाकवः सुता नासत्या वृक्तबर्हिषः ।
आ यातं रुद्रवर्तनी ॥
verses.iast: dasrā yuvākavaḥ sutā nāsatyā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ | ā yātaṃ rudravartanī ||
verses.translation: O wondrous, ever-young Nāsatyas, come along the Rudra-path to the pressed Soma on the strewn grass.

verses.devanagari:
इन्द्रा याहि चित्रभानो सुता इमे त्वायवः ।
अण्वीभिस्तना पूतासः ॥
verses.iast: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ | aṇvībhis tanā pūtāsaḥ ||
verses.translation: Come, O Indra of radiant light; these libations are pressed and purified for you.

verses.devanagari:
इन्द्रा याहि धियेषितो विप्रजूतः सुतावतः ।
उप ब्रह्माणि वाघतः ॥
verses.iast: indrā yāhi dhiyeṣito viprajūtaḥ sutāvataḥ | upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ ||
verses.translation: Indra, driven by inspired thought and stirred by the seer, come to the chants where Soma is pressed.

verses.devanagari:
इन्द्रा याहि तूतुजान उप ब्रह्माणि हरिवः ।
सुते दधिष्व नश्चनः ॥
verses.iast: indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ | sute dadhiṣva naś canaḥ ||
verses.translation: Hastening, O tawny-steeded Indra, come to the hymns; at the pressing accept our offering for us.

verses.devanagari:
ओमासश्चर्षणीधृतो विश्वे देवास आ गत ।
दाश्वांसो दाशुषः सुतम् ॥
verses.iast: omāsaś carṣaṇīdhṛto viśve devāsa ā gata | dāśvāṃso dāśuṣaḥ sutam ||
verses.translation: All gods, upholders of mankind, come here—come to the sacrificer’s pressed Soma.

verses.devanagari:
विश्वे देवासो अप्तुरः सुतमा गन्त तूर्णयः ।
उस्रा इव स्वसराणि ॥
verses.iast: viśve devāso apturaḥ sutam ā ganta tūrṇayaḥ | usrā iva svasarāṇi ||
verses.translation: Swift, rain-bringing gods all, come to the pressing—like the sun’s rays hastening toward the days.

verses.devanagari:
यज्ञं वो देवाः कृणुते सन्ति होतार आप्र्णः ।
अग्ने मित्रावरुणा उशन् ॥
verses.iast: yajñaṃ vo devāḥ kṛṇute santi hotāra āpṛṇaḥ | agne mitrāvaruṇā uśan ||
verses.translation: A sacrifice is prepared for you, O gods; the hotars are in place—Agni, and Mitra-Varuṇa to be invoked.

verses.devanagari:
पावका नः सरस्वती वाजेभिर्वाजिनीवती ।
यज्ञं वष्टु धियावसुः ॥
verses.iast: pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhir vājinīvatī | yajñaṃ vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ ||
verses.translation: May Sarasvatī the purifier, rich in insight and bounty, favor our rite with manifold strengths.
